newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 2 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 2 PM.

text.p: * President Emil Constantinescu met the Czech foreign and defence ministers during his two-day official visit to Prague.
* Constantinescu hailed Radio Free Europe's (RFE) contribution to the fall of communism during a news conference at the RFE headquarters in Prague.
RFE should continue to exist to allow a better knowledge of the problems the Central and East European countries face in their transition towards a market economy, Constantinescu said.
* Constantinescu praised the Romanian people for its confidence in the country's president and prime minister despite painful costs of reforms.
* The cabinet holds an extraordinary meeting to discuss the 1997 state budget law which is expected to be handed to parliament next Monday.
* The private advertising company Creative Media caused losses worth $6.0 million to the state television, said Valerian Stan, head of the government's control body.
* The lower Chamber of Deputies passed the government's ordinance to allow prices to be adjusted regularly, according to the local leu exchange rate to the dollar.
* Five workers died on Tuesday at the Calafat thermal power plant when a crane broke and collapsed from 30 metre high.
* Transport Minister Traian Baseascu awarded Romanian athlete Gabriela Szabo a 10 million lei prize for winning the world title for the 3,000 metres run.
* Basescu sacked Radu Farmus, head of the Bucharest metro utility, for illegaly increasing the employees' wages by 30 percent.
